The [report itself](https://www-ssl.intel.com/content/www/us/en/technology-in-education/making-her-future.html) indicates that girls and women involved with making, designing and creating things with electronic tools may build stronger interest and skills in computer science and engineering. Read the full report at [intel.com/girlsintech](http://www.intel.com/girlsintech).

ict4d_links.title: ICT4D.at

ict4d_links.title: ICTLogy
ict4d_links.description: From [Ismael Peña-López](http://ictlogy.net/about-me/), one of the longest-running ICT sites and blogs. Many great links and resources.

ict4d_links.title: ICTLogy Blog
ict4d_links.description: From [Ismael Peña-López](http://ictlogy.net/about-me/), one of the longest-running ICT sites and blogs. Many great links and resources.

ict4d_links.title: ICTs for Development
ict4d_links.description: Blog associated with [University of Manchester’s Centre for Development InformaticsBlog associated with [University of Manchester’s Centre for Development Informatics](http://www.cdi.manchester.ac.uk/). [Richard Heeks](https://ict4dblog.wordpress.com/author/richardheeks/) is a must-follow.

ict4d_links.title: ICTWorks
ict4d_links.description: One of the most well-known blogs for all things ICT.

ict4d_links.title: Information Technologies & International Development Journal
ict4d_links.description: Open-access journal that focuses on the intersection of information and communication technologies (ICTs) with the "other four billion".

ict4d_links.title: International Network for Postgraduate Students in the area of ICT4D (IPID)
ict4d_links.description: Informal group with announcement about ICT4D-related news and opportunities aimed at higher education roles.

ict4d_links.title: Internews Innovation Tools
ict4d_links.description: Searchable and browsable index of tools targeting the field of media development.

ict4d_links.title: ITU Newslog
ict4d_links.description: The International Telecommunications Union. They have some of the best data and global reports.

ict4d_links.title: Journal of Information Systems in Developing Countries
ict4d_links.description: International forum for practitioners, teachers, researchers and policy makers to 'share their knowledge and experience in the design, development, implementation, management and evaluation of information systems and technologies in developing countries.'

ict4d_links.title: kiwanja.net
ict4d_links.description: Blog from [Ken Banks](http://www.kiwanja.net/kenbanks), one of ICT4D's most recgonzied practitioners.

ict4d_links.title: Knowledge Management for Development
ict4d_links.description: Fairly good and wide-ranging blog with new articles often (despite the dated appearance of the site).

ict4d_links.title: Knowledge Sharing Tools
ict4d_links.description: Knowledge-sharing resources organized by sectors in international development, including agriculture, fisheries, food and nutrition, forestry and sustainable development.

ict4d_links.title: Kopernik Impact Tracker
ict4d_links.description: Review of simple tools to collect data, communicate with clients, and measure impact. Targeting nonprofits and social enterprises.

ict4d_links.title: London ICT4D Meetup
ict4d_links.description: Monthly meetups in London.

ict4d_links.title: Many Possibilities
ict4d_links.description: Blog from ICT4D giant Steve Song.

ict4d_links.title: Matt Haikin Blog
ict4d_links.description: Personal site/blog of ICT4D professional in the UK. Great links to [Tech for M&E](https://matthaikin.com/useful-tech-for-monitoring-evaluation/) and [ICT4D Meetups](https://matthaikin.com/ict4d-meets/).

ict4d_links.title: MentatWiki
ict4d_links.description: Mental challenges and tips.

ict4d_links.title: Mhealth Knowledge
ict4d_links.description: Connecting global health professionals to people, products, and ideas.

ict4d_links.title: MicroMasters
ict4d_links.description: Course in 'Data, Economics, and Development Policy' from MIT's Banerjee and Duflo.

ict4d_links.title: MINDSZ
ict4d_links.description: Ideas, inventions and products every day from all walks of life.

ict4d_links.title: Mobile for Development (GSMA) Blog
ict4d_links.description: Blog for the team within GSMA that focuses on emerging markets.

ict4d_links.title: NetHope Solutions Center
ict4d_links.description: Catalog of technology solutions, products, and services.

ict4d_links.title: No Excuse List
ict4d_links.description: Learn anything.

ict4d_links.title: Panoply Digital Blog
ict4d_links.description: Blog of the consultancy organization in the UK that focuses on ICT.

ict4d_links.title: Peace Direct
ict4d_links.description: Prize awards for local peacebuilding -- $10,000 and online promotion of your work.

ict4d_links.title: Phone Arena
ict4d_links.description: Phone finder and comparer, allows you to filter through various specifications.

ict4d_links.title: Product Chart
ict4d_links.description: Gadget search and filters -- good for comparing the latest in phones, computers, appliances, and all types of gadgets.

ict4d_links.title: Project Euler
ict4d_links.description: Challenging mathematical/computer programming problems.

ict4d_links.title: Research ICT Africa
ict4d_links.description: Run by [Alison Gillwald](http://www.researchictafrica.net/people.php) Regional ICT policy and regulation think tank active across Africa and the Global South.

ict4d_links.title: Tech Salons
ict4d_links.description: Regular meetings on technology topics in different cities.

ict4d_links.title: The Open Knowledge Foundation’s DataHub site
ict4d_links.description: Open datasets from everywhere.

ict4d_links.title: The Toolbox
ict4d_links.description: Links to resources, articles, and tools targeted at citizen activists (and founded by Peter Gabriel!).

ict4d_links.title: The Wirecutter
ict4d_links.description: Lists and reviews of all types of gadgets -- cameras, projectors, phones, routers, etc.

ict4d_links.title: Tim Unwin's Blog
ict4d_links.description: Blog from Tim Unwin, UNESCO Chair in ICT4D and Emeritus Professor of Geography at Royal Holloway, University of London.

ict4d_links.title: Timbuktu Chronicles
ict4d_links.description: News about Africa innovations around technology and entrepreneurship.

ict4d_links.title: UN University - Computing and Society
ict4d_links.description: Research institute at the intersections of ICTs and international development.

ict4d_links.title: UNESCO Chair in ICT4D
ict4d_links.description: Group of researchers and practitioners between UNESCO, Royal Holloway, and University of London. Chair is [Tim Unwin](https://unwin.wordpress.com/).

ict4d_links.title: UNICEF Innovation Fund
ict4d_links.description: A newer funding source that may be of interest to communities.

ict4d_links.title: WSIS ICTD Projects Database
ict4d_links.description: Database of ICT activities carried out by governments, international organizations, the business sector, civil society and others.

ict4d_links.title: Fab Foundation
ict4d_links.description: Non-profit 501(c) 3 organization that provides access to the tools, the knowledge and the financial means to educate, innovate and invent using technology and digital fabrication to allow anyone to make (almost) anything, and thereby creating opportunities to improve lives and livelihoods around the world.

ict4d_links.title: Field Ready
ict4d_links.description: Social enterprise that combines a wealth of practical field knowledge, advanced qualifications, expert advisors and an open innovation process that has created an opportunity to address some of the most difficult problems faced in remote and difficult places to work.

ict4d_links.title: Humanitarian Makers
ict4d_links.description: Makers, designers, and engineers using 'make' approaches for issues of social good.

ict4d_links.title: Libraries without Borders
ict4d_links.description: NGO working in knowledge and culture-based development in the world and supporting libraries in developing countries.

ict4d_links.title: Maker Education Initiative
ict4d_links.description: Non-profit organization that provides educators and institutions with the training, resources, and community of support they need to create engaging, inclusive, and motivating learning experiences through maker education.

ict4d_links.title: Makernet
ict4d_links.description: International initiative providing systems and tools that connect makers and makerspaces to local markets and manufacturing infrastructure.

ict4d_links.title: How Libraries Are Becoming Modern Makerspaces
ict4d_links.description: Article that traces the transition for many libraries to become more general 'makerspaces'.

ict4d_links.title: When Making Is Inclusive, Good Things Happen
ict4d_links.description: Makerspaces as inclusive spaces for communities.

ict4d_links.title: TechShop
ict4d_links.description: Community of makerspaces and techshops.

ict4d_links.title: This to That
ict4d_links.description: Glue advice.

ict4d_links.title: African Innovation Spaces (Google Sheet)
ict4d_links.description: Map of Tech & Start-up Hubs across Sub-Saharan Africa from the Cambridge-based [Fab Foundation](http://www.fabfoundation.org/), with the help of [BongoHive Tech Hub in Zambia](http://bongohive.co.zm/).

ict4d_links.title: Field Ready Thingiverse List
ict4d_links.description: Useful 3D items from [Field Ready](http://www.fieldready.org/).

ict4d_links.title: Instructables
ict4d_links.creator: Assistive Technology Channel
ict4d_links.description: Walkthrough instructions for projects that have an assistive technology focus.

ict4d_links.title: Makepedia
ict4d_links.description: Open design sharing platform.

ict4d_links.title: Maker Map Resources
ict4d_links.description: An ongoing open source project which aims to create a global database of maker resources - from workspaces to incubators - which is powered by the maker community and easily searchable on any device.

ict4d_links.title: Maker Resources for Educators
ict4d_links.creator: Intel Education
ict4d_links.description: One of the best one-stop-shops for all things Makerspace -- especially geared towards educators.

ict4d_links.title: Maker Share
ict4d_links.description: A community of makers sharing what they can do.

ict4d_links.title: Maker Space Ideas
ict4d_links.creator: International Development Innovation Network (IDIN)
ict4d_links.description: QuickStart guide to Starting Your (Urban) Maker/Hacker/Innovation Space.

ict4d_links.title: MakerEd
ict4d_links.description: Engaging, inclusive, and motivating learning experiences through maker-centered education for educators.

ict4d_links.title: Makerspaces in Libraries
ict4d_links.creator: Libraries & Maker Culture: A Resource Guide
ict4d_links.description: Compendium of links and organizations working in the Libraries and Maker Culture space.

ict4d_links.title: Space: Intel Education Idea Showcase
ict4d_links.creator: Intel Engage
ict4d_links.description: Activities and lessons, many of which are creative and makerspace-related.

ict4d_links.title: ESRI
ict4d_links.description: GIS enterprise organization offering software and training.

ict4d_links.title: GIS Corps
ict4d_links.description: Coordinates short term, volunteer based GIS services to underprivileged communities

ict4d_links.title: GroundTruth Initiative
ict4d_links.creator: Department of State
ict4d_links.description: Helping communities use digital media, mapping, and open data tools for greater influence and representation in development and democracy.

ict4d_links.title: A Case Study in Eastern Indonesia
ict4d_links.creator: Health Mapping in a Low Resource Setting
ict4d_links.description: Mostly about HOT, but a great description of the team doing a bunch of work prior to and during the Nepal earthquake.

ict4d_links.title: Crowdsourcing 2.0: Why Putting the Slum on a Map is not Enough
ict4d_links.description: A defense-of-mapping but with cautions, particularly with the famous Kibera, Kenya example.

ict4d_links.title: OpenStreetMap: Mapping Power to the People
ict4d_links.description: Promoting the use of mapping from Kibera project lead.

ict4d_links.title: The Internet Mapmakers Helping Nepal
ict4d_links.creator: The Atlantic
ict4d_links.description: A great overview of the Nepal mappers example.

ict4d_links.title: Why Mapping is Important
ict4d_links.description: The 'famous' Kibera example from Kenya.

ict4d_links.title: Animated Choropleths
ict4d_links.description: Step-by-step approach to creating an animated, interactive choropleth map using rMaps and DataMaps.

ict4d_links.title: Big Map
ict4d_links.description: Print large maps of OSM data from your browser.

ict4d_links.title: Carto
ict4d_links.description: Browser-based mapping and analysis of location data. Use [CartoDB Map Academy](http://academy.cartodb.com/) to learn how to create maps on the web and visualize geospatial data using CartoDB.

ict4d_links.title: Choropleth Map Example
ict4d_links.description: Beautiful example from Mike Bostock (D3 creator) that shows the code and raw data for creating a choropleth map (color-gradient map).

ict4d_links.title: D3
ict4d_links.description: JavaScript library for manipulating documents based on data. Helps make awesome maps -- but has a high learning curve.

ict4d_links.title: D3 Bostock Bubble Map
ict4d_links.description: Building a simple map with D3.

ict4d_links.title: Datamaps
ict4d_links.description: Customizable SVG map visualizations for the web in a single JavaScript file using D3.js.

ict4d_links.title: Distillery
ict4d_links.description: Simplify geoJSON at variable rates.

ict4d_links.title: dropchop.io
ict4d_links.description: Browser-based GIS powered by Mapbox.js and Turf.js.

ict4d_links.title: Esri Story Maps
ict4d_links.description: Combine authoritative maps with narrative text, images, and multimedia content. They make it easy to harness the power of maps.

ict4d_links.title: Field Papers
ict4d_links.description: Print an atlas, record what you see in the world through street mapping, and upload the data to OpenStreetMap.

ict4d_links.title: GeoNames Name Server
ict4d_links.description: Official repository of standard spellings of all foreign geographic names, sanctioned by the United States Board on Geographic Names (US BGN). The database also contains variant spellings (cross-references), which are useful for finding purposes, as well as non-Roman script spellings of many of these names. Download the [Country Files](http://geonames.nga.mil/gns/html/namefiles.html) for offline use. The [GeoNames](http://www.geonames.org/) site compiles a lot of these and additional datasets as well.

ict4d_links.title: Google Fusion Tables
ict4d_links.description: An experimental data visualization web application to gather, visualize, and share data tables. Allows for maps, charts, Motion Chart a.k.a. GapMinder, etc.

ict4d_links.title: Google Maps
ict4d_links.description: An industry standard. Has directions, ability to add custom layers/point, Street View, and a bunch of other things. Also, has apps with more and more increased (and offline) functionality for smartphones.

ict4d_links.title: Google Spreadsheet Chart Maps
ict4d_links.description: Quick but can sometimes be limited. Convenient if you're already using Google Sheets.

ict4d_links.title: Great Circles Connections
ict4d_links.description: Mapping connections globally with circle arcs.

ict4d_links.title: Here Maps
ict4d_links.description: Road-centric maps. Built by a consortium of car manufacturers -- the offline apps are really great.

ict4d_links.title: Leaflet.js
ict4d_links.description: an open-source JavaScript library for mobile-friendly interactive maps.

ict4d_links.title: MapBox
ict4d_links.description: Pick from a dozen beautifully designed maps and create an application from it in just a few seconds. Great for creating visually appealing maps from pre-existing or pre-cleaned data. Also has iOS, Android, and mobile web versions.

ict4d_links.title: Mapbox.js
ict4d_links.description: Built on top of Leaflet, is an open-source library to be used with JavaScript.

ict4d_links.title: MapHub
ict4d_links.description: Make your own map by adding points, lines, polygons or labels; allows you to import and export easily.

ict4d_links.title: MapOSMatic
ict4d_links.description: Generate maps of cities using OpenStreetMap data. The generated maps are available in PNG, PDF and SVG formats and are ready to be printed.

ict4d_links.title: Mapshaper
ict4d_links.description: Tools for editing geospatial vector data.

ict4d_links.title: Mike Bostock Maps Tutorial (D3)
ict4d_links.description: Make a modest map from scratch using D3 and TopoJSON.

ict4d_links.title: ModestMaps
ict4d_links.description: Small mapping framework.

ict4d_links.title: Natural Earth Data
ict4d_links.description: Public domain map dataset available at 1:10m, 1:50m, and 1:110 million scales. Featuring tightly integrated vector and raster data.

ict4d_links.title: OpenStreetMap
ict4d_links.description: Open-source map created by community of mappers that contribute and maintain data about roads, trails, cafés, railway stations, and much more, all over the world. Check out the [wiki](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Main_Page) for more information.

ict4d_links.title: OpenStreetMap Directions
ict4d_links.description: Google Maps alternative for directions (routing from point A to point B) using OSM.

ict4d_links.title: PolyMaps
ict4d_links.description: JavaScript Maps Library.

ict4d_links.title: Stamen Maps
ict4d_links.description: Toner, terrain, and watercolor maps, free for the taking.

ict4d_links.title: Topojson
ict4d_links.description: Extension of JSON for topography.

ict4d_links.title: Vector Maps
ict4d_links.description: Various formats and projections.

ict4d_links.title: Adobe Illustrator
ict4d_links.description: Typically used for vector art, but also great for doing visualization of certain map parts.

ict4d_links.title: ESRI
ict4d_links.creator: ArcGIS
ict4d_links.description: The industry-standard in GIS software and solutions. The suite of ESRI tools is pretty expansive, ranging from consumer-level items like their smartphone apps all the way up to enterprise-level server platforms.

ict4d_links.title: Mapbox Studio
ict4d_links.creator: Mapbox
ict4d_links.description: Design studio to create stunning interactive maps (formerly TileMill).

ict4d_links.title: Maps.me
ict4d_links.description: Download fast, detailed and completely offline maps for mobile devices.

ict4d_links.title: Photoshop
ict4d_links.description: The industry standard for imaging and design.

ict4d_links.title: QGIS
ict4d_links.description: Free and Open Source Geographic Information System. Basically, compares to ArcGIS Desktop. Has Windows, Mac, and Linux versions available. Check out their [QGIS Tutorials and Tips](http://www.qgistutorials.com/en/), this [QGIS Walkthrough (video) - TechChange](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L0r1GNTT-0o), and this [QGIS Interactive Tutorial - Harvard](http://maps.cga.harvard.edu/qgis/).

ict4d_links.title: R
ict4d_links.description: Software programming language and software environment for statistical computing and graphics.

ict4d_links.title: Tableau
ict4d_links.description: Data visualization and business intelligence software (with built-in mapping charts and widgets).

ict4d_links.title: A Guide to Geocoding International Locations
ict4d_links.description: Quite relevant for projects that are trying to clean up a great deal of messy data.

ict4d_links.title: AidData
ict4d_links.description: Geospatial data and tools enabling development stakeholders to more effectively target, coordinate and evaluate aid. Lots of good datasets and analysis in the International Development sector.

ict4d_links.title: Climate Change and African Political Stability Map
ict4d_links.creator: Robert Strauss Center
ict4d_links.description: Comparing climate change to political stability with an Esri map (complete with controls and sliders).

ict4d_links.title: David Rumsey Historical Map Collection
ict4d_links.description: 80,000 maps and historical images from all over the world.

ict4d_links.title: Demographic and Health Surveys
ict4d_links.creator: DHS
ict4d_links.description: DHS analyzes and distributes survey results regarding health, nutrition, HIV for over 75 countries.

ict4d_links.title: Ellipsoid World with georeference lines and names
ict4d_links.description: Site with a bunch of links to vector-based maps and shapefiles of the whole Earth. Good for building things in Illustrator or Sketch or the web.

ict4d_links.title: Free GIS Data
ict4d_links.description: A list of links to over 300 sites providing freely available geographic datasets, all ready for loading into a Geographic Information System.

ict4d_links.title: Geodata for Development: A Practical Approach
ict4d_links.description: A surprisingly good read that walks through a lot of the main issues involved in developing and using maps in the International Development sector.

ict4d_links.title: GeoPlatform
ict4d_links.description: Shared and trusted geospatial data, services, and applications for use by the public and by government agencies and partners to meet their mission needs. Integrated with Data.gov.

ict4d_links.title: GIS Lounge
ict4d_links.description: Introduction to using GIS data, find up to date and interesting types of raster and vector data and further resources to other downloading sites.

ict4d_links.title: HealthMap
ict4d_links.description: Real-time intelligence on a broad range of emerging infectious diseases for a diverse audience including libraries, local health departments, governments, and international travelers.

ict4d_links.title: LearnOSM
ict4d_links.description: Tutorials on a variety of OSM topics, including the ID editor, the JOSM editor, Field Papers, organizing mapping trainings, remote mappings, using a GPS device and more. Tutorials are in English, German, French, Croatian, Bahasa Indonesia, Italian, Chinese, Norwegian, Portuguese, Russian and Kiswahili.

ict4d_links.title: Malaria Atlas Project
ict4d_links.description: Disseminates free, accurate and up-to-date information on malaria and associated topics, organized on a geographical basis.

ict4d_links.title: Map Pron
ict4d_links.creator: Reddit
ict4d_links.description: Subreddit devoted to new/interesting maps. Great for inspiration and falling down black holes.

ict4d_links.title: MapGive
ict4d_links.description: An initiative of the State Department's Humanitarian Information Unit. Several highly recommended video tutorials explaining the importance of OSM for humanitarian response and how to edit using the ID editor.

ict4d_links.title: Mapillary
ict4d_links.description: Crowd-street Street Views.

ict4d_links.title: Open Educational Geography Resources
ict4d_links.creator: Penn State
ict4d_links.description: Wide range of free online geography and GIS courses, including Problem-Solving with GIS, Cartography and Visualization, Open Web Mapping, and Location Intelligence for Business.

ict4d_links.title: Poverty Net
ict4d_links.creator: World Bank
ict4d_links.description: Resource site for measuring and analyzing poverty - includes Poverty Mapping section under Topics link, with Poverty Mapping Documents and Links which has good links to examples of articles and programs.

ict4d_links.title: The Upsidedown Map Page
ict4d_links.description: Site showing different types of maps as 'upside-down'. Awesome resource to use in lessons with students about the cultural and political nature of maps. Which way is 'up'? Why does it feel 'wrong' if indeed it does?

ict4d_links.title: The World Bank Maps
ict4d_links.creator: World Bank
ict4d_links.description: Mapping data globally, regionally, country-level, and thematically across all World Bank projects.

ict4d_links.title: UNDP Projects
ict4d_links.creator: UNDP
ict4d_links.description: Detailed information on the UNDP's 6,000+ development projects in 177 countries and territories worldwide. Browse the summaries, click a filter on the right, or search through the full list of projects.

ict4d_links.title: What3words
ict4d_links.description: A universal addressing system based on a 3mx3m global grid.

ict4d_links.title: WorldPop
ict4d_links.description: Open access archive of spatial demographic datasets for Central and South America, Africa and Asia to support development, disaster response and health applications.

ict4d_links.title: 7 Tips for Better Digital M&E in Sustainable Development
ict4d_links.creator: ICT Works
ict4d_links.description: Great run-down. Simplicity is key!

ict4d_links.title: Four principles for Theories of Change in global development
ict4d_links.creator: ODI
ict4d_links.description: Excellent broad overview of Theory of Change. Includes focus on process, prioritize learning, be locally led, and think compass not map.

ict4d_links.title: Indicators Registry
ict4d_links.creator: Humanitarian Response
ict4d_links.description: Guidance tool for countries to select indicators, and where possible seek standard definitions and applications of those indicators. It lists the principal needs and response monitoring indicators for each cluster and provides a unique identifier, similar to a p-code, for every indicator.

ict4d_links.title: Useful tech for Monitoring & Evaluation
ict4d_links.creator: Matt Haikin
ict4d_links.description: Probably the best rundown on the Internet of the various tech and M&E platforms of most interest to ICT4D professionals.

ict4d_links.title: Ways to Practice Responsible Development Data
ict4d_links.creator: Responsible Data
ict4d_links.description: From the Responsible Data Forum.

ict4d_links.title: Akvo Flow
ict4d_links.description: Custom-built for international development projects with an emphasis on maps and offline functionality. Well-integrated with Akvo support. Android-only.

ict4d_links.title: Commcare
ict4d_links.description: Android-only. Notable organizations using this include Save the Children and the WHO.

ict4d_links.title: CommCare Learning Tracks
ict4d_links.description: For use with Dimagi's CommCare platform specifically (though the lessons can be generalized).

ict4d_links.title: DataWinners
ict4d_links.description: Android-only, slick drag-and-drop interface on the web.

ict4d_links.title: Echo Mobile
ict4d_links.description: Mobile data collection platform from Nairobi-based NGO that uses SMS, USSD, and Android data collection. (broken 9/18)

ict4d_links.title: Epicollect
ict4d_links.description: iOS and Android (though EpiCollect+ is Android-only). Actually a pretty slick setup, and paid for by the Imperial College London so it really is free and open-source. Uses the Google App Engine as the back-end, so some assembly required (the cost of free). Organizations using it include FAO.

ict4d_links.title: Feedback Labs
ict4d_links.description: Resources and tools to help you collect feedback -- organized by type of collection and sector.

ict4d_links.title: Get Your Degree in M&E Tech with TechChange
ict4d_links.creator: ICT Works
ict4d_links.description: This four-week online certificate course will focus on building skills and strategies to better collect, manage, analyze and visualize data using a variety of tech tools. It will feature live interactive guest expert presentations with leading M&E practitioners, software developers, and data scientists. It will also include a unique hands-on learning environment with animated videos, technology demos, practical activities, networking events, immersive simulations and more.

ict4d_links.title: Humanitarian Nomad
ict4d_links.description: Selection tool to help connect your organization or project with a mobile data collection solution.

ict4d_links.title: iFormBuilder
ict4d_links.description: iOS, Android, and SMS app. Many options for data types, and does well with multimedia. Fair documentation. Notable organizations using it include Mercy Corps and PSI.

ict4d_links.title: Kashana
ict4d_links.description: An open-source MEL information system for international development.

ict4d_links.title: Kobotoolbox
ict4d_links.description: Drag-and-drop interface, built on top of [ODK](https://opendatakit.org/) and [Enketo](https://enketo.org/) (web forms).

ict4d_links.title: Lime Survey
ict4d_links.description: Browser-based survey platform that has a range of free and paid versions.

ict4d_links.title: Magpi
ict4d_links.description: iOS, Android app (SMS on the Pro plan). I like their drag-and-drop builder and web-review of data entries.

ict4d_links.title: Medic Mobile
ict4d_links.description: Software toolkit that combines smart messaging, decision support, easy data gathering and management, and health system analytics.

ict4d_links.title: Open Data Kit
ict4d_links.description: Open-source suite of tools built for mobile data collection. It underlies a lot of the other internationally-oriented mobile data collection platforms around, and while geared slightly towards developers, is still accessible to field teams as well.

ict4d_links.title: Pendragon
ict4d_links.description: Data collection company with custom data collection tools for iOS and Android. Oriented more towards the enterprise market.

ict4d_links.title: POIMapper
ict4d_links.description: iOS and Android, fairly straightforward but focused on maps (POI is Point of Interest).

ict4d_links.title: Qualtrics
ict4d_links.description: Geared towards enterprise and academically-robust data collection -- many custom form and devices options.

ict4d_links.title: Riwi
ict4d_links.description: Global survey platform -- oriented towards organizations looking for large samples of pseudo random users.

ict4d_links.title: SMAP
ict4d_links.description: Data collection platform with open-source server and associated with Smap Consulting.

ict4d_links.title: Survey Monkey
ict4d_links.description: One of the earlier and larger browser-based survey tools -- many various features and pricing levels.

ict4d_links.title: TaroWorks
ict4d_links.description: Android-only, built on the Salesforce platform and originally designed for project management purposes. I haven't played with this one a ton.

ict4d_links.title: Telerivet
ict4d_links.description: Global messaging platform oriented towards SMS communications.

ict4d_links.title: Text It
ict4d_links.description: SMS messaging platform with interesting built-in flow controls for more natural 2-way communications.

ict4d_links.title: Typeform
ict4d_links.description: Web-based platform for forms. Can also be integrated into other platforms.

ict4d_links.title: Ushahidi
ict4d_links.description: A web-based platform for mapping information from reports from SMS, Twitter, e-mail, and web. Initially used to map election violence and intimidation in Kenya.

ict4d_links.title: ViewWorld
ict4d_links.description: iOS and Android. Slick and familiar interface (Bootstrap, for you nerds). It's got good user group controls and sub-items (or sub-forms), and good data validation (by a manager or coordinator on the back-end). No "logic" functions. Organizations using it include CARE and the Danish Red Cross.

ict4d_links.title: Mobile Data Collection: A New Frontier of Tech4Dev Research
ict4d_links.creator: YouTube
ict4d_links.description: Webinar hosted by [Engineers for Change](https://www.engineeringforchange.org/) that explores the challenges of data collection in field research, how data collection has been leveraged to collect more timely, accurate, and reliable data, and where the data collection field is headed.

ict4d_links.title: Evidence Gap Maps
ict4d_links.description: Evidence gap maps (EGMs) consolidate what we know about what works in particular development sectors or thematic areas. 3ie's EGMs identify evidence from systematic reviews and impact evaluations and provide a graphical display of areas with strong, weak or non-existent evidence on the effects of development programs and initiatives. It's very cool and useful, but only available for a limited number of topics relevant to Youth, CED, HE, and ED.

ict4d_links.title: USAID Program Evaluations
ict4d_links.description: USAID's evaluations page which links to their processes and data.

ict4d_links.title: USAID's Development Data Library
ict4d_links.description: The Development Data Library (DDL) is USAID's public repository of Agency-funded, machine readable data. The DDL is part of USAID's commitment to evidence-based programming and rigorous evaluation, while supporting the principles of the President's Open Government Initiative. This website provides raw data rather than the analysis or conclusions made from data.

ict4d_links.title: USAID's Development Experience Clearinghouse
ict4d_links.description: USAID's Development Experience Clearinghouse (DEC) is the largest online resource for USAID-funded technical and program documentation from more than 50 years of USAID's existence, with more than 155,000 documents available for viewing and electronic download. It's searchable: Use words or phrases, or perform more advanced searches. You can also comment on documents, rate them, or vote on them to increase their usefulness to others.

ict4d_links.title: Developing Radio Partners
ict4d_links.description: US-based non-profit media development organization that works with local radio stations in developing countries, providing them with the skills they need to bring reliable information to those who need it most.

ict4d_links.title: Farm Radio International
ict4d_links.description: Canadian charity working with more than 500 radio partners in 38 African countries to fight poverty and food insecurity.

ict4d_links.title: "Ebola Hero" shares how radio saved lives in Liberia
ict4d_links.creator: United Nations Radio
ict4d_links.description: How radio was a significant tool in the fight against Ebola.

ict4d_links.title: 8 Lessons Learned to Improve ICT-enabled FM Radio Station Sustainability
ict4d_links.creator: ICT Works
ict4d_links.description: Great article giving 8 recommendations for improving radio ICT programming.

ict4d_links.title: Empowering Local Radios with ICTs
ict4d_links.creator: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
ict4d_links.description: UNESCO's project "Empowering Local Radios with ICTs" aims to bridge the gap between poor people - especially women and girls - and the public debate on issues of local public concern.

ict4d_links.title: ICT4D: Don't forget the radio when discussing mobile technology in developing countries.
ict4d_links.creator: Slate
ict4d_links.description: Often overlooked, but radio has consistently been a powerful tool for broadcasting useful messages.

ict4d_links.title: Interactive Radio for Agricultural Development Projects
ict4d_links.description: Toolkit for practitioners.

ict4d_links.title: Curiosity Machine
ict4d_links.creator: Iridescent
ict4d_links.description: Science education non-profit offers flexible STEM education tool that can be adapted to any learning environment.

ict4d_links.title: GESCI (Global E-Schools and Communities Initiative)
ict4d_links.description: International NGO and works with developing country governments and agencies in Africa, Asia, and Latin America to leverage technology as a catalyst for improving access and quality of education.

ict4d_links.title: GLOBE (Global Learning and Observations to Benefit the Environment)
ict4d_links.description: International science and education program that provides students and the public worldwide with the opportunity to participate in data collection and the scientific process, and contribute meaningfully to our understanding of the Earth system and global environment.

ict4d_links.title: Iridescent
ict4d_links.description: Education non-profit that trains professional engineers, scientists, and parents to deliver cutting-edge STEM education to underserved girls, children and their families through two flagship programs: Technovation and Curiosity Machine.

ict4d_links.title: NASA
ict4d_links.description: Independent agency of the executive branch of the United States federal government responsible for the civilian space program as well as aeronautics and aerospace research.

ict4d_links.title: Smithsonian Education
ict4d_links.description: Over 2,000 resources for educators and teachers to use.

ict4d_links.title: ABCya
ict4d_links.description: A wide variety of activities, lessons, and games for students to learn about many different concepts in math and language arts. The concepts are separated by grade level, and cover grades K-5.

ict4d_links.title: APlusMath
ict4d_links.description: Provides interactive math activities to help students improve their math skills. Aplusmath.com has become one of the top math websites in the world and contains many useful resources for parents, teachers and students.

ict4d_links.title: BBC BiteSize Science
ict4d_links.description: Learning and revision resources, learner guides for primary and secondary students, and class clips (videos for teachers to use in the classroom).

ict4d_links.title: Curriculum & Resources
ict4d_links.description: Videos, games, resources, ebooks, curriculum, and apps. Be sure to check the "free resources only" filter.

ict4d_links.title: DIY.org
ict4d_links.description: Online community for kids to focused on building skills and STEM-related activities.

ict4d_links.title: Explore Smithsonian
ict4d_links.description: From the Smithsonian Science Education Center, dedicated to formal preK-12 science education reform.

ict4d_links.title: Good Thinking
ict4d_links.description: Animated series that helps teachers teach science.

ict4d_links.title: HowToSmile
ict4d_links.description: Lets you search over 3,500 of the very best science and math activities on the web. Find handpicked activities from your favorite science museums, public television stations, universities, and other educational organizations. All activities are available to anyone, free of charge. Start searching now and filter by age, material costs, and learning time to find exactly what you need for your class, educational program, or family.

ict4d_links.title: IBM Activity Kits
ict4d_links.description: Kits aimed at helping not-for-profit organizations understand their technology needs, sharing the fun of math and science with school children.

ict4d_links.title: IXL
ict4d_links.description: List of key math skills that students should learn in different grades. For each concept, they provide practice questions that become harder as you correctly answer them.

ict4d_links.title: Kidport
ict4d_links.description: Many offers lots of "think-and-learn" math activities for grades K-8. There are also links to information from other subjects, such as English, history, and science.

ict4d_links.title: Make the most of Your UNIVERSE
ict4d_links.creator: NASA's Chandra X-Ray Observatory
ict4d_links.description: Tools to help you learn more about the Universe that all of us inhabit.

ict4d_links.title: PBS Kids
ict4d_links.description: Many engineering games that allow students to solve mysteries with Curious George, build robots, and create their own engineering challenges to solve.

ict4d_links.title: Science Kids
ict4d_links.description: Contains many different resources for students to learn about the various concepts of engineering. There are fun project ideas, quizzes, experiments, and videos to engage kids.

ict4d_links.title: Sheppard Software
ict4d_links.description: Hundreds of free, online, educational games for kids.

ict4d_links.title: Smithsonian Learning Lab
ict4d_links.description: Digital resources from across the Smithsonian's 19 museums, 9 major research centers, the National Zoo, and more, can be used together, for learning.

ict4d_links.title: TeachersTryScience Lesson Plans
ict4d_links.description: Hands-on lessons focused on environmental science. Each lesson is integrated with effective teaching strategies, practical how-to's and other helpful supports.

ict4d_links.title: Teaching Engineering
ict4d_links.description: Searchable, web-based digital library collection populated with standards-based engineering curricula for use by K-12 teachers and engineering faculty to make applied science and math come alive through engineering design in K-12 settings.

ict4d_links.title: Web Adventures
ict4d_links.creator: Rice University
ict4d_links.description: Six interactive adventures in science where you will help solve a problem.
